intro: Coronopus zambiensis, commonly known as the Zambian crownflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are yellow with a distinctive crown-like structure, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Coronopus zambiensis is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
